result.execSummary:
The defendant Briana Marie Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week;

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence defendant is currently serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Briana Marie Butterfield

defendant.name: Butterfield, Briana Marie
defendant.address: c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 1947, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:48 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Adam Fontana.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Manufacture-Deliver Amphetamine/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 7 yrs imprisonment - 2.5 yrs IC & 4.5 yrs ES - with NO days credit - CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT ORDERS sentence to run CONCURRENT to any other sentence def is currently serving. 
Adj: 3:57 pm
Taycheedah Correctional Institution

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 03:10 pm.
